<ce:section-title id="st035">The synthesis of <ce:bold>1</ce:bold> and <ce:bold>2</ce:bold> was as follows 
</ce:section-title><ce:para id="p0020" view="all">HAFT (20 mmol) was dissolved in distilled water (20 ml), and charged into a glass reactor with a water bath. It was kept under mechanical stirring and heated to the temperature of 60 °C. Cd(NO<ce:inf loc="post">3</ce:inf>)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf> (1 mol/L, 12 ml) was added to the HAFT solution during 15 min with continuous stirring. Then, acidified hydrazine hydrate (10 mmol) or acidified oxalyl-dihydrazide (15 mmol), dissolved in distilled water (30 ml), was added to the solution during 5 min and keeping for 30 min. In the end, the solution was cooled to room temperature naturally. Single crystal suitable for X-ray measurement was obtained by evaporation of the mother liquor at room temperature for one week.</ce:para><ce:para id="p0025" view="all">[Cd(NH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>NH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>)(AFT)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·0.7H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O]<ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf>
</ce:italic> (<ce:bold>1</ce:bold>): Yield: 50% (based on AFT). CdN<ce:inf loc="post">16</ce:inf>C<ce:inf loc="post">6</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">9.4</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">2.7</ce:inf> (461.35): calcd. C 15.62, H 2.05, N 48.59; found C 15.72, H 2.23, N 48.52. IR (KBr): 3429, 3327, 3167, 2150, 1784, 1605, 1568 and 768 cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup> (<ce:glyph name="sbnd"></ce:glyph>NH and <ce:glyph name="sbnd"></ce:glyph>NH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>), 1633 cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup> (N<ce:glyph name="dbnd"></ce:glyph>N), 1242 cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup> (<ce:glyph name="sbnd"></ce:glyph>CN), 1153 and 1034 cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup> (tetrazole-ring).</ce:para><ce:para id="p0030" view="all">[Cd(ODH)<ce:inf loc="post">1.5</ce:inf>(AFT)<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>·5H<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>O]<ce:italic>
<ce:inf loc="post">n</ce:inf>
</ce:italic> (<ce:bold>2</ce:bold>): Yield: 30% (based on AFT). CdN<ce:inf loc="post">20</ce:inf>C<ce:inf loc="post">9</ce:inf>H<ce:inf loc="post">13</ce:inf>O<ce:inf loc="post">10</ce:inf> (673.79): calcd. C 16.04, H 1.94, N 41.58; found C 15.86, H 2.34, N 41.32. IR (KBr): 3465, 3335, 3286, 1596 and 784 cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup> (<ce:glyph name="sbnd"></ce:glyph>NH and <ce:glyph name="sbnd"></ce:glyph>NH<ce:inf loc="post">2</ce:inf>), 1732 cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup> (<ce:glyph name="sbnd"></ce:glyph>C<ce:glyph name="dbnd"></ce:glyph>O), 1249 cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup> (<ce:glyph name="sbnd"></ce:glyph>CN), 1124 and 1066 cm<ce:sup loc="post">−1</ce:sup> (tetrazole-ring)<ce:float-anchor refid="f0040"></ce:float-anchor>.</ce:para>
clean_text:
The synthesis of 1 and 2 was as follows  

HAFT (20mmol) was dissolved in distilled water (20ml), and charged into a glass reactor with a water bath. It was kept under mechanical stirring and heated to the temperature of 60°C. Cd(NO3)2 (1mol/L, 12ml) was added to the HAFT solution during 15min with continuous stirring. Then, acidified hydrazine hydrate (10mmol) or acidified oxalyl-dihydrazide (15mmol), dissolved in distilled water (30ml), was added to the solution during 5min and keeping for 30min. In the end, the solution was cooled to room temperature naturally. Single crystal suitable for X-ray measurement was obtained by evaporation of the mother liquor at room temperature for one week.

[Cd(NH2NH2)(AFT)2⋅0.7H2O] n  (1): Yield: 50% (based on AFT). CdN16C6H9.4O2.7 (461.35): calcd. C 15.62, H 2.05, N 48.59; found C 15.72, H 2.23, N 48.52. IR (KBr): 3429, 3327, 3167, 2150, 1784, 1605, 1568 and 768cm-1 (NH and NH2), 1633cm-1 (NN), 1242cm-1 (CN), 1153 and 1034cm-1 (tetrazole-ring).

[Cd(ODH)1.5(AFT)2⋅5H2O] n  (2): Yield: 30% (based on AFT). CdN20C9H13O10 (673.79): calcd. C 16.04, H 1.94, N 41.58; found C 15.86, H 2.34, N 41.32. IR (KBr): 3465, 3335, 3286, 1596 and 784cm-1 (NH and NH2), 1732cm-1 (CO), 1249cm-1 (CN), 1124 and 1066cm-1 (tetrazole-ring).
